From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: schutz, Schütz, and schütz

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German schuz. See the verb schützen (“to defend”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ʃʊt͡s/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Schutz
  • Homophone: Schutts

Noun

[edit]

Schutz m (strong, genitive Schutzes, plural Schutze or (rare, Switzerland) Schütze)

  1. (uncountable) protection
  2. (countable) protective installation

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Schutz [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Schutz die Schutze, Schütze2
genitive eines des Schutzes der Schutze, Schütze2
dative einem dem Schutz, Schutze1 den Schutzen, Schützen2
accusative einen den Schutz die Schutze, Schütze2

1Now rare, see notes.
2Rare, Switzerland.

  • Abhörschutz

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Schutz” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Schutz” in Duden online
  • “Schutz” in Deutsches Wörterbuch von Jacob und Wilhelm Grimm, 16 vols., Leipzig 1854–1961.
  • Friedrich Kluge (1883), “Schutz”, in John Francis Davis, transl., Etymological Dictionary of the German Language, published 1891

Hunsrik

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German schuz. See the verb schützen (“to defend”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈʃut͡s/
  • Rhymes: -uts
  • Syllabification: Schutz

Noun

[edit]

Schutz m

  1. protection

Further reading

[edit]
  • Boll, Piter Kehoma (2021), “Schutz”, in Dicionário Hunsriqueano Riograndense–Português, 3rd edition (overall work in Portuguese), Ivoti: Riograndenser Hunsrickisch

Plautdietsch

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle Low German schutten, from Proto-Germanic *skutjaną, probably from Proto-Indo-European *(s)kewd- (“to drive, fall upon, rush”). Compare German schützen (“to defend”).

Noun

[edit]

Schutz m

  1. protection
  2. security
